source:
今日は雑学クイズのバラエティ番組収録だ。
優勝目指して頑張ってくれ、杏！
translatedstr:
Today we're recording a variety show of miscellaneous quizzes.
Good luck in your bid for the championship, Anzu!

source:
えー……優勝とかどうでもいいよー。
そのために頑張るのは、杏のポリシーに反するし
translatedstr:
Ehhh ...... I don't care if I win or not!
And it's against Anzu policy to work hard for it.

source:
ポリシーって、『楽してアイドル』ってやつか？
でも両方美味しいとこどりなんて、難しいだろ
translatedstr:
Is the policy the "Enjoy and be an idol" thing?
But it's hard to get the best of both worlds.

source:
難しいことにあえて挑戦する……。
それが杏の美学なのであった。キリッ
translatedstr:
Dare to try something difficult. ......
That was the aesthetics of Anzu.

source:
いいこと言ってる風だけど、
結局、頑張らずに美味しい思いがしたいってことだな
translatedstr:
It sounds like a nice thing to say,
After all, you want a good meal without trying too hard.

source:
まあ、特に優勝は目指さないで、
できたらラッキーくらいでやってくるよ
translatedstr:
Well, don't particularly aim for the championship,
I'll be lucky if I can do it.

source:
分かった。
ここはひとつ、杏らしい仕事っぷりを頼むよ
translatedstr: I'm asking you to do one thing here, and do it in Anzu way.

source:
オッケー、任せて。とりあえず、
全力で頑張りすぎるのはどうかと思うんだよね
translatedstr:
Okay, I'll take care of it,
I don't know if I'm trying too hard to do everything I can.

source:
クイズを正解しつつ、外しつつ。
程よくテキトーっていうのが杏らしいんじゃない？
translatedstr:
While getting the quiz right, while getting it off.
I think being moderately straightforward is typical of Anzu.

source:
そうだな、杏の言うことも一理ある。
じゃあ、杏には……
translatedstr:
Yes, Anzu has a point.
Then I'll let the Anzu know: ......

source: ５０％の力を出す
translatedstr: Give 50% of your strength.

source: ８０％の力を出す
translatedstr: Give 80% effort

source: １０％の力を出す
translatedstr: Give 10% of your strength.

source: １００％の力を出す
translatedstr: Giving 100% effort

source: ５０％の力を出すくらいがいいんじゃないか？
translatedstr: I think it's enough to give 50% effort.

source:
そうだね。
そのくらいがちょうど良さそうかも
translatedstr:
Yes, it is.
Maybe that's about right.

source:
半分とぼけて、半分良いとこ見せる。
アイドルとしては良いバランスだよね
translatedstr:
Half bluffing, half showing off the best parts.
It's a good balance for an idol.

source:
（杏は計算していたかのように、
５０％の解答率でクイズに答えていった）
translatedstr:
(As if Anzu had calculated,
(They answered the quiz with a 50% answer rate.)

source:
（杏らしい解答率だと他の出演者からも好評で、
ディレクターも杏の仕事を褒めていた！）
translatedstr:
(The other performers liked the solution rate, which was typical of Anzu,
(The director also praised Anzu's work!)

source: 頑張って８０％の力を出してくれ！
translatedstr: Good luck and give 80% effort!

source:
８０％って、そこそこ答えちゃうカンジだけど。
まあ、プロデューサーがそういうなら
translatedstr:
80% is a bit high, but I think I can answer that question.
Well, if that's what the producer says.

source:
その代わり、ちゃんと報酬は用意しておいてね。
具体的にはおいしい飴をこれくらい♪
translatedstr:
In return, make sure you have the right rewards.
Specifically, delicious candy this much â

source:
（杏は宣言通り真剣にクイズに挑み、
難問にも答えてスタジオを盛り上げた）
translatedstr:
(Anzu took the quiz seriously, as she declared,
(She also answered some difficult questions and got the studio going.)

source:
（面白い画が撮れたとディレクターも喜んでいたが、
杏に報酬が足りないと怒られてしまった）
translatedstr:
(Although the director was pleased with the interesting picture she got,
(I got mad at Anzu for not rewarding me enough)

source: １０％くらいでいいんじゃないか？
translatedstr: I think it should be about 10%.

source:
えっ、そのくらいでいいの？
そんじゃ、気楽に収録させてもらうね～
translatedstr:
What? That's about right?
Well, then, I'll take it easy and let you record it.

source:
（杏は宣言通り、
クイズを数問答えただけで終えた……）
translatedstr:
(Anzu is as declared,
(I just finished answering a few questions on the quiz: ......)

source:
（杏なりに良い仕事が出来たと喜んでいたが、
ディレクターには不評だった……）
translatedstr:
(Although I was pleased that I had done a good job in my Anzu way,
(It was not well received by the director. ......)

source:
もちろん１００％に決まってる。
全問正解を目指して頑張ろう！
translatedstr:
Of course it has to be 100%.
Let's try to answer all the questions correctly!

source:
そういうキャラで、番組に呼ばれてないと思うけど。
まあ、プロデューサーがそういうならやってみるよ
translatedstr:
That's the kind of character I don't think I was invited to be on the show.
Well, if the producer says so, I'll give it a shot.

source:
（杏は共演者を寄せ付けない実力で、
全問正解を果たしてみせた……）
translatedstr:
(Anzu is a talented actress who can keep her co-stars at bay,
(......), who answered all questions correctly.

source:
（しかし、これではクイズ番組にならないと、
後日、出演者を見直して再収録することになった）
translatedstr:
(But this would not be a quiz show,
(The cast was later reviewed and re-recorded.)

source: （今回の仕事は成功だ！）
translatedstr: (This job was a success!)

source: （今回の仕事は失敗だ。次こそは！）
translatedstr: （This job was a mistake...next time!)

source:
（『杏ののんびり温泉旅』という、
旅企画の依頼が杏にやってきた）
translatedstr:
(It is called "Anzu's leisurely hot spring trip,
(A request for a travel project came to Anzu.)

source:
ねえ、プロデューサー。この番組って、
ほんとに杏が温泉に入るだけでいいの？
translatedstr:
Hey, producer, what's this show about?
Are you sure you want to just have Anzu in the hot springs?

source:
確か、そういう内容だったと思うが。
……うん、企画書を見る限り、それだけの内容だ
translatedstr:
I believe that's what it was about.
...... Yeah, that's what the proposal says.

source:
ふふっ。さっすがプロデューサー。
いい仕事を取ってきてくれるって信じてたよ
translatedstr:
Hmmm....that's my producer.
I knew you would get me a good job.

source:
あっ、でも、いくつかの温泉を巡るみたいで、
徒歩で移動しながら町ぶらロケもするみたいだな
translatedstr:
Oh, but it looks like we are going to visit several hot springs,
Looks like we'll be moving around on foot and doing some town-hopping locations.

source:
ちょっと、それを早く言ってよ。
ぜんぜん話が違うじゃんかー
translatedstr:
Hey, you need to get that out of your system.
That's a totally different story!

source:
そんな歩き回るロケなんて、杏には無理だよ。
想像しただけで疲れてきた……
translatedstr:
That kind of walking around on location is impossible for Anzu.
I'm getting tired just thinking about it: ......

source:
そんなこと言うなよ。
温泉街の町ぶらロケなんて楽しそうじゃないか
translatedstr:
Don't say that.
A location shoot in a hot spring resort town sounds like a lot of fun, doesn't it?

source:
まあ、温泉街自体はいいんだけどさ。
徒歩で移動っていうのはどうにもならないの？
translatedstr:
Well, the spa town itself is fine.
Can't we just get around on foot?

source:
ちゃんと確認しなかった俺にも落ち度があるか……。
ここはひとつ……
translatedstr:
I guess I'm at fault for not checking properly. ......
Here's one: ......

source: ご当地飴を探す
translatedstr: Find local candies

source: タクシーを使う
translatedstr: take a cab

source: 迎えを呼ぶ
translatedstr: call a person to come to the door

source: 歩く
translatedstr: walk

source:
そうだ！　温泉街で、
ご当地飴を探すって企画を提案してみるよ
translatedstr:
Yes! In a hot springs resort,
I'll suggest a project to find a local candy.

source:
ご当地飴かぁ。うん、悪くないね。
それなら、面白そうな味もありそうだし
translatedstr:
Local candy...yes, not bad.

プロデューサー、後で温泉街の情報教えて。
ちょっと、調べておくから
translatedstr:
Producer, give me some information about the spa town later.

source:
（杏は下調べしておいたお店で、
効率的にご当地飴をゲットしていった）
translatedstr:
(Anzu are at a restaurant I had prearranged,
(They efficiently got the local candy)

source:
（杏は最低限の労力を使って、温泉に入り大満足。
番組も濃い内容となり、大評判の旅番組となった！）
translatedstr:
(Anzu was very satisfied with the hot springs with minimal effort.
(The program also turned out to be an intense and well-received travel program!)

source:
よし。
ロケ用に専用のタクシーを用意しよう！

All right.
Let's get a dedicated cab for the location!

source:
えっ、ほんとに？
プロデューサー、ありがと♪

What, really?

町ぶらでタクシー移動っていうのも、

translatedstr:
Or, you could just take a cab to the town,
It's funny because it's so Anzu, I'll discuss it with you.

source:
うん、杏らしくて面白い撮影ができると思うよ。
ねえねえ、タクシーの中で昼寝してもいいよね？
translatedstr:
Yes, I think it will be an interesting shoot, just like Anzu.
Hey, hey, can I take a nap in the cab?

source:
（新しい発想と杏のキャラにあっているからと、
杏のタクシー温泉街、町ぶらロケは採用された）
translatedstr:
(Because it was a new idea and Anzu character,
(Taxi spa town of Anzu, town hanging out location was adopted)

source:

ゆるゆるの杏の姿が可愛いと、高評価を得た！）
translatedstr:
(Take a nap in a cab, and then relax in a hot spring. Anzu .......

source:
収録が終わったら、

translatedstr:
After the recording is done,

source:
えっ、それだけなの？　収録が始まったら、

translatedstr:
What, that's it? When the recording starts,

source:
（迎えを用意した結果、杏はいち早く帰ろうと
最低限の収録で仕事を終わらせた……）
translatedstr:
(As a result of preparing a pick-up, Anzu wanted to return home as soon as possible.

source:
（番組を作る素材が少ないと、編集者が頭を抱え、

translatedstr:
(When there is not enough material to make a program, the editor has a headache,
(She's anxious ...... to see if the program can be completed.)

source:
歩くしかないな。
そういう企画なんだから、杏も理解してくれ
translatedstr:
We'll have to walk.
That's how we plan it, and Anzu need to understand that.

source:
ふーん。ディレクターに相談しないで、

translatedstr:
Hmmm...don't consult the director,

source:
（杏は企画通り、温泉街を歩き町ぶらロケをしたが、

translatedstr:
(Anzu walked around the hot spring town as planned and did a town-hopping location,

source:
（小さい子に無理をさせるな、とのクレームが

translatedstr:
(Complaints about not pushing the little ones too hard.
(It was determined that the program was about to go in and the program was put on hold. ......)

source: （今回の仕事は成功だ！）
translatedstr: (This job was a success!)

source: （今回の仕事は失敗だ。次こそは！）
translatedstr: （This job was a mistake...next time!)

source: 杏、トーク番組の司会の仕事の件だけど……
translatedstr: Anzu, about the talk show hosting job: ......

source:
えー、これから昼寝をしようと
準備してたところなのに……
translatedstr:
Well, I'm about to take a nap.
I was just getting ready to ......

しかも、トーク番組の司会者って、

translatedstr:
And what's a talk show host?
I have to read the atmosphere and stuff and be flexible.

source:
場の空気を読む仕事は、杏には向いてないと思うな。
他の人に任せた方が上手くいくって
translatedstr:
I don't think Anzu are suited for the job of reading the atmosphere of the place.
She said it would work better if someone else handled it.

source:
お、落ち着いてくれ杏。
大物芸能人も多数出る、大事な番組なんだ
translatedstr:
Oh, calm down, Anzu.
It's an important show with a lot of big-name celebrities.

source:
大物芸能人かあ……。それなら余計に杏じゃなくて、

translatedstr:
A big celebrity...or .........not an extra Anzu then,
I'm sure it would go more smoothly if someone else were to host the event.

source:
とにかく、ずっと話していなくちゃいけないのが、
杏的には困るなー
translatedstr:
Anyway, I have to talk all the time,
I don't want to be Anzu-y.

source:
それに、杏に大物芸能人の相手をさせたいなら、
やる気が出る何かがないと……ちらっ
translatedstr:
Besides, if you want Anzu to deal with big-name celebrities,
I need something to motivate me. ...... glimpse

source:
……わかったよ。
杏が仕事をしやすいように……
translatedstr:
...... I understand.
To make it easier for Anzu to do their work: ......

source: 司会を共演者に振る
translatedstr: Shake the chair with your co-hosts.

source: ご褒美を用意する
translatedstr: Prepare a reward.

source:
もうひとり
司会者を用意する
translatedstr:
one more (person)
Provide a moderator.

source: 適当に進める
translatedstr: Proceed as you see fit.

source:
司会を共演者に振ってみるのはどうだ？
舵取りはしつつ、でもほぼ成り行きって感じで
translatedstr:
How about swinging the moderator to your co-host?
I'm trying to steer the ship, but it's almost like it's happening.

source:
おっ、流石プロデューサー、いいアイディアだね。
それでいいなら、杏は大賛成だよ
translatedstr:
Whoa, great idea, quintessential producer.

source:
じゃ、台本に書いてない進行をするってことを、

translatedstr:
Then, I'll tell you what I'm going to do: I'm going to do an unscripted progression,

（杏は言葉巧みに共演者へ話題を振り、

translatedstr:
(Anzu verbally swept the topic over to her co-star,

source:
（番組的にも今までにない進行だと、

translatedstr:
(She said that this is a new progression in terms of programming,

translatedstr:
It would be hard to work with big-name celebrities,

特別な飴？　それって、味が特別ってこと？
それとも、量がスペシャルって感じ？
translatedstr:
Special candy? You mean it tastes special?

source: ……質も量も特別な飴を約束する

source:
ふふっ、さすがプロデューサー。
それじゃ、ご褒美のために頑張ろうかなー
translatedstr:
Phew, that's a great producer.

source:
（ご褒美につられたのか、

translatedstr:
(Did you get caught up in the rewards?

source:
（番組も軽快なトークで盛り上がり、

translatedstr:
(The program was also lively with light-hearted talk,

source:

translatedstr:

source:
（杏は適当にコメントをし、

translatedstr:
(Anzu made appropriate comments,

source:
（番組自体は滞りなく進んでいったが、

translatedstr:
(Although the program itself went on without a hitch,
It was re-recorded (......) to make more use of Anzu.

source:
むしろ、ゆるく司会するのはどうだ？
ダラっとした司会も面白いかもしれない
translatedstr:
Rather, how about loosely moderating?

source:
オッケー。まっ、ディレクターも
それを分かってて、杏を起用したんだろうからね
translatedstr:
Ok, well, the director, too.
I'm sure they knew that, and that's why they appointed Anzu.

source:
（杏は司会者らしからぬ、
適当なトークで番組を進めていった……）
translatedstr:
(Anzu is not like a moderator,
(......) which proceeded the program with appropriate talk.

source:
（しかし、杏が力を抜きすぎて番組にならないと、
ディレクターからＮＧが入ってしまった……）
translatedstr:
(But she said that Anzu are too relaxed to be a program,
(The director gave me a NG: ......)

source: （今回の仕事は成功だ！）
translatedstr: (This job was a success!)

source: （今回の仕事は失敗だ。次こそは！）
translatedstr: （This job was a mistake...next time!)

source:
（事務所で仕事をしていると、
疲れた顔の杏がやってきた）
translatedstr:
(Working in an office, she said,
(A tired-looking Anzu came in.)

source:
どうした、杏。
今日はいつも以上に覇気がないな
translatedstr:
What's wrong, Anzu.
You're even less dominant today than usual.

source:
ふわぁ……。ソファを美希ちゃんに取られちゃって、
杏の昼寝する場所がなくて困ってるんだよ
translatedstr:
Wow ....... Miki took my couch,
I'm having trouble finding a place for Anzu to take a nap.

source:
そういえば、さっきから寝ていたような……。
美希を起こしてくるか
translatedstr:
By the way, I think I was sleeping earlier: .......

source:
せっかく昼寝してるのに、起こすのはよそうよ。
安眠を妨害される気持ち、杏にはよく分かるからね
translatedstr:
Let's not wake her up when she's taking a nap.

source: なるほど。それなら……
translatedstr: I see...then ......

source: ソファを増やす
translatedstr: More sofas

source: 美希と一緒に寝る
translatedstr: Sleep with Miki

source: 使わない
translatedstr: I don't use it.

source: ソファを増やすのを検討してみるか
translatedstr: I'd consider adding a couch.

source:
おおっ、さすがプロデューサー。
円満解決するナイスなアイディアだね！
translatedstr:
Oh, you are indeed a producer.

source:
でも、今すぐに用意するっていうのは無理だ。
音無さんにも相談しないといけないからな
translatedstr:
But it's impossible to prepare it right now.
I'll have to talk to Otonashi-san about it.

source: 美希と一緒に仲良く寝たらどうだ？
translatedstr: Why don't you and Miki sleep together in peace?

source:
うーん、潰されそうでちょっと怖いなあ……。
それにふたり一緒だと、狭くて快眠できないよ
translatedstr:
Hmmm, I'm a little afraid of being crushed. ......
Besides, you two together are too small to get a good night's sleep.

source: 諦めて使わなければいいんじゃないか？
translatedstr: Why not just give up and not use it?

source:
その選択肢はないっ。
昼寝したいときに昼寝しないでいつするのさ
translatedstr:
That is not an option.
If you don't take a nap when you want to, when do you do it?

source:
はぁ、ソファで昼寝は諦めるとするよ……。
しかたない、杏だけの安住の地を開拓してこようっと
translatedstr:
Huh, I think I'll give up napping on the couch. ......

source:
（杏、かなり眠たそうだったけど……。
どこか他に、良い昼寝場所はあったかな？）
translatedstr:
(Anzu, you looked pretty sleepy. .......

source: （杏とショッピングモールに買い出しに来た……）
translatedstr: (Anzu and I went shopping at the mall ......)

あっ、見て見て、プロデューサー。
お菓子の移動販売だって
translatedstr:
Oh, look, look, look, producer.

source:
へぇ、本当だ。
カラフルなお菓子がいっぱい並んでいるな
translatedstr:
Heh, really.
That's a lot of colorful candy.

source:
どれもおいしそうだけど、杏はやっぱ飴だね。
プロデューサーは、どの飴がおいしそうだと思う？
translatedstr:
They all look delicious, but Anzu are still candy.
Which candy do you think looks better for the producer?

source:
おいしそうな飴か……。
そうだな……
translatedstr: Looks like a tasty candy or .......

source: ピンク色の飴
translatedstr: Pink candy

source: 茶色の味
translatedstr: Taste of brown

source: 深緑色の飴
translatedstr: dark green candy

source:
見た目からして、
ピンク色の飴だろうな……。
translatedstr:
From the looks of it,
It would be pink candy. ......

source:
おっ、ストロベリー味って英語で書いてあるよ。
甘い系かな、すっぱい系かな……気になるー
translatedstr:
Whoa, it says strawberry flavor in English.
I wonder if it's sweet or sour ......

source: なんとなくだけど、茶色の飴かな
translatedstr: Somehow, I'm thinking brown candy.

source:
たぶん、コーヒー味じゃないかな？
あんまり苦くなかったら、おいしそうかも
translatedstr:
Maybe it's coffee flavored?
If it wasn't too bitter, it might taste good.

source:
深緑色の飴だな。
見た目からして、面白い味がしそうだからな
translatedstr:
It's a dark green candy.
From the looks of it, it's going to taste interesting.

source:
……青汁味って書いてあるよ。
うう、本当においしいのかな……
translatedstr:
...... It says it's green juice flavored.
Ugh, I wonder if it really tastes good: ......

source:
せっかくだから、事務所に置く飴ってことで、
どれか買っていこうか
translatedstr:
Since we're here, I'll just say it's candy to put in my office,
Shall I buy any of them?

source:
ほんとに？　プロデューサー、太っ腹だね。
お礼にひと袋だけ、杏が荷物持ちしてあげるよ♪
translatedstr:
Really? Producers, you're so thick.
In return, I'll give you a bag of Anzu to carry.

source:
『ひと袋だけ』って……
そんな何袋も買わないぞ！？
translatedstr:
Just one bag." ......
I'm not buying that many bags!

source:
（ゲーム雑誌を買うため、
杏と本屋にやって来たのだが……）
translatedstr:
(To buy a game magazine,
I came to a bookstore with Anzu (......)

source:
どうしたんだ、杏。
お目当ての雑誌はあったんだろう？
translatedstr:
What's wrong, Anzu?
You found the magazine you were looking for, didn't you?

source:
ちょっと、他の本でも読んでみようかなって。
ほら、杏のモットーって楽してアイドルでしょ？
translatedstr:
I thought, hey, I'll read something else.
You see, Anzu's motto is to have fun and be an idol, right?

source:
だから楽しながら稼ぐための方法を探そうと思って。
ねぇ、プロデューサー。どの本を読めばいいのかな？
translatedstr:
So I decided to find a way to make money while having fun.
Hey producer, which book should I read?

source:
動機はちょっと不純かもしれないが……
そうだな、読むとしたら……
translatedstr:
Motives may be a bit impure. ......
Yes, you can read it: ......

source: 睡眠学習の本
translatedstr: Sleep Study Books

source: 経済の入門書
translatedstr: An Introduction to the Economy

source: アイドルの雑誌
translatedstr: Idol magazine

source:
睡眠学習の本なんてどうだ。
寝ている間に、知識を頭に詰め込むんだ
translatedstr:
How about a sleep study book.
While you sleep, stuff your head with knowledge.

source:
睡眠学習……。なんだかマユツバものっぽいけど、
寝ているだけでいいなら、試す価値はありそうだね
translatedstr:
Sleep Study: ....... It's kind of like a Maytag thing,
If all you need to do is sleep, it sounds like it's worth a try.

source:
知識をつけたいんだったら、
経済の入門書なんてどうだ？
translatedstr:
If you want to gain knowledge,
How about a primer on economics?

source:
経済の本かぁ。たしかに実践的だけど、
結果が出るには時間かかりそうだよね
translatedstr:
An economic book...yes, it's practical,
It's going to take a long time to see results.

source:
アイドルの雑誌なんてどうだ？
他のアイドルを参考にして、今後の活動に活かすんだ
translatedstr:
How about an idol magazine?
We're going to use other idols as references for what we're going to do in the future.

source:
それじゃあ結局、働くことになってるじゃんか。
働かずして報酬を得る方法を、杏は探してるんだって
translatedstr:
Then you end up working, don't you?
Anzu says she's looking for a way to get paid without working.

source:
だけど、型にはまった成功方法はないと思うぞ。
そこは自分で切り開いていくものじゃないか
translatedstr:
But I don't think there's an unconventional way to succeed.
You have to make your own way there, don't you?

source:
おっ、それってナイスアイディアじゃない？
アイドルの成功の仕方を、杏が本で教えるの
translatedstr:
Whoa, isn't that a nice idea?
Anzu will teach you how to be a successful idol in her book.

source:
名付けて『杏直伝！　楽してアイドル道！』
というわけだから、ライターの準備よろしくねー
translatedstr:
It's called "Anzu Direct! The Way of the Idol for Fun!
So please get your writers ready!

source:
ライターの準備って……。
そこまで言って、自分で書かないつもりなのか……
translatedstr:
Writer's Preparation is at .......
Are you going to say that much and not write it yourself: ......

source:
（以前、杏が出演したバラエティ番組を
一緒に見ていた……）
translatedstr:
(I used to have a variety show that Anzu appeared in.
(......) which we watched together.

source:
うん、面白かったぞ。番組自体も良かったし、
杏もしっかり番組内で、自分の役割を果たしていたな
translatedstr:
Yeah, it was fun, and the show itself was good,
Anzu also did her part well in the program.

source:
まあねー。収録の雰囲気を察して、
それなりに働いてみたって感じかな
translatedstr:
Well, you get the idea of the atmosphere of the recording,
I guess I tried to work at it.

source:
十分、活躍していたと思うけど……。
やっぱりそれなりに、だったのか
translatedstr:
I think you were active enough. ......
I knew it was, in its own way.

source:
あれだけの対応力があるんだったら、
もっと、大きな番組にも出られると思うぞ
translatedstr:
If only they were that responsive,
I'm sure you'll get more, you know, bigger shows.

source:
労働と報酬のバランスが見合っていればねー。あっ、
もしかして、プロデューサーがご褒美をくれるとか
translatedstr:
As long as the balance between work and reward is right,
Maybe the producer will give you a reward.

source: 杏へのご褒美っていうと……
translatedstr: A reward for Anzu would be ......

source: いろんな飴
translatedstr: Various candies

source: ゲームを数本
translatedstr: A few games

source: 洋服を数着
translatedstr: A few clothes

source: もっといろんな飴を用意しろってことか？
translatedstr: Are you saying I should have more candy of all kinds?

source:
ふふっ。よく分かってるじゃん。
だらだら昼寝をしながら、食べる飴は最高だからね
translatedstr:
You know exactly what you're talking about.
Because candy is the best thing you can eat while taking a lazy nap.

source: ゲームを増やせばいいのか？
translatedstr: More games?

source:
うーん。それも嬉しいけど、
じっくりとゲームをやる時間が欲しいよね
translatedstr:
Well, I'm glad to hear that, too,
I'd love some time to sit back and play the game.

source: 可愛い洋服を用意すればいいのか？
translatedstr: Do I just need some cute clothes?

source:
洋服はきらりが用意してくれるから大丈夫だよ。
それに、だらだら休めるＴシャツで十分だし
translatedstr:
Don't worry, Kirari will provide the clothes.
Besides, a T-shirt is enough for a sloppy rest.

source:
前提として、だらだらすることが
条件に入っている気がするんだが……
translatedstr:
The premise is that slacking off is
I think it's in the terms and conditions: ......

source:
ふふっ、よく気づいたね。プロデューサー。
一番のご褒美は労働からの解放だからね
translatedstr:
Hmmm...well noticed, producer.
The best reward is freedom from labor.

source:
プロデューサーもいっぱい働いてるみたいだしさ、
自分へのご褒美ってことで、１ヵ月くらい休も？
translatedstr:
It seems like a lot of producers are working a lot,
Can I take a month off as a reward for myself?

source:
１ヵ月は無理だな。でも、リフレッシュのために、
休みの日を用意するのも悪くないか……
translatedstr:
Not for a month...but for a refresher,
Wouldn't it be nice to have a day off? ......

source:
（仕事が終わり、時間に余裕があったので、
杏と一緒にゲームセンターへとやってきた）
translatedstr:
(I had some time to spare after work,
(I came to the arcade with Anzu.)

source:
ここのゲーセン、広いね～。
あっ。あの筐体、甜花ちゃんと話してた新作のやつだ
translatedstr:
The arcade here is huge!
Oh, that chassis is the new one I was talking about with Beetika.

source:
相変わらず、
杏は甜花と仲が良いんだな
translatedstr:
As usual,
Anzu must be good friends with Tenka.

source:
うん、まあね。甜花ちゃんとは、
趣味とか考えとか、杏と似ているところがあるみたい
translatedstr:
Yeah, well, with Tenka-chan,
She seems to have similar interests and thoughts to Anzu.

source:
確かに、言われてみればそうだな。
杏と甜花の共通点といえば……
translatedstr:
Sure, if you ask me.
Speaking of similarities between Anzu & Tenka......

source: ゲーム好き
translatedstr: gamer (someone who likes games)

source: 昼寝好き
translatedstr: nap lover

source: お菓子好き
translatedstr: confectionery lover

source: やっぱりゲーム好きなところか
translatedstr: I guess that's where you like to play games.

source:
うん。協力プレイとか対戦とかするよ。甜花ちゃんと
事務所にいるときは、ゲームで忙しいんだよね
translatedstr:
Yes, I'll play co-op and competitive games with Tenka.
When you're in the office, you're busy playing games.

source: 昼寝が好きなところかな？
translatedstr: Is it the part where she likes to take naps?

source:
そうだね。美希ちゃんも昼寝好きメンバーだけど。
いつもみんなで、事務所のソファ争奪戦をしてるね
translatedstr:
Yes, Miki is also a member who likes to take naps.
You always have everyone fighting for the couch in your office.

source: どっちもお菓子が好きだもんな
translatedstr: They both like candy, don't they?

source:
いや、それは杏と甜花ちゃんだけじゃなくて、
みんなお菓子は好きだと思うけど
translatedstr:
No, it's not just Anzu and Tenka-chan,
I think everyone likes sweets.

source:
まあ、甜花ちゃんだけじゃなくて、ルミナスに入って
いろんな子に出会えて良かったと思ってるよ
translatedstr:
Well, not only Tenka-chan, but also join Luminous.
I'm glad I've met so many different girls.

source:
……そうか。その気持ちを大切にして、
これからも活動を頑張っていこうな
translatedstr:
...... Okay...keep that feeling in mind,
Keep up the good work on your activities.

source: （杏を連れて、近くのコンビニまで買い出しにきた）
translatedstr: (I took Anzu to a nearby convenience store to get some groceries.)

source:
ねぇプロデューサー。杏、歩くの疲れた～。
買い出しを手伝ったんだから、ご褒美……あるよね？
translatedstr:
Hey producer. Anzu, I'm tired of walking!
I helped you buy the food, so there's a reward ......, right?

source:
ああ、そうだな。
ただし、ひとつだけだぞ
translatedstr: But there's only one thing you can do.

source: （さて、何にするか……）
translatedstr: (Well, what to ......)

source: アイス
translatedstr: ice cream

source: ポテトチップス
translatedstr: potato chips

source: あんまん
translatedstr: bun with anko filling

source: 杏、買い出しに付き合ってくれたお礼だ
translatedstr: Anzu, thanks for taking me shopping.

source:
アイスじゃん！　さっすがプロデューサー、
杏のこと分かってるね～♪
translatedstr:
That's ice cream! That's the producer,
You know your Anzu~♪

source: （よし！　すごく喜んでくれているな……！）
translatedstr: (Okay! You're making me very happy. ......!)

source: 杏、買い出しに付き合ってくれたお礼だ
translatedstr: Anzu, thanks for taking me shopping.

source:
お、ポテチだ。ありがとプロデューサー。
この味気になってたんだよね
translatedstr:
Oh, here's a potato chip, thanks producer.
I've been wondering about this flavor.

source: （喜んでくれたようだ）
translatedstr: (She seemed pleased.)

source: 杏、買い出しに付き合ってくれたお礼だ
translatedstr: Anzu, thanks for taking me shopping.

source: あんまんかー。ありがたく貰っておくよ
translatedstr: I'll take it gratefully.

source: （うーん……イマイチだったらしい）
translatedstr: (Hmmm ...... wasn't great, apparently)

source: （仕事帰り、息抜きに杏とゲームセンターに寄った）
translatedstr: (After work, I stopped by the arcade with Anzu for a break.)

source:
杏、何かお勧めのゲームはないか？
俺でも一緒にできそうなやつを……
translatedstr:
Anzu, do you have any game recommendations?
I'll see what I can do with you: ......

source:
あっ……！　杏、クレーンゲームがいいな。
ほら、いい感じの景品が入ってるよ。頑張ってね♪
translatedstr:
Oh, ......! Anzu, I like the crane game.
See, there's a nice giveaway in there...good luck...Â

source: ……俺に取ってってことか
translatedstr: You mean ...... take it for me.

source: （杏が好きそうな景品は……）
translatedstr: (A giveaway that Anzu might like is ......)

source: フィギュア
translatedstr: figure

source: クッション
translatedstr: cushion

source: タオル
translatedstr: (hand) towel

source: それじゃあ、フィギュアを狙ってみるか
translatedstr: Well, let's go for the figure then.

source:
あっ、杏が今やってるゲームのキャラだ。
プロデューサー、あの右のキャラのがほしいな
translatedstr:
Ah, it's a character from the game Anzu is playing right now.
Producer, I'd like that one on the right character.

source: （よし、フィギュア狙いで正解だったな！）
translatedstr: (Okay, you were right to go for the figure!)

source: それじゃあ、クッションを狙ってみるか
translatedstr: Well, let's go for the cushion then.

source:
うん、比較的取りやすそうだよね。
ゲットできたら杏の昼寝用に使おうかな
translatedstr:
Yeah, it seems relatively easy to get.
If I can get it, I'll use it for Anzu naps.

source: （うん、それなりに楽しんでいるみたいだ）
translatedstr: (Yeah, she seems to be enjoying herself in her own way.)

source: それじゃあ、タオルを狙ってみるか
translatedstr: Well, let's go for the towel then.

source:
タオルかあ……。今使ってるタオルが
気に入ってるからな～……
translatedstr:
Towels, ah ....... The towels I'm using right now.
I love it... ......

source: （うーん、あんまり関心がないようだ）
translatedstr: (Hmmm, doesn't seem to interest me much.)

source:
なあ、杏。最近ルミナスの中で、
モノマネが流行っているって聞いたぞ
translatedstr:
Hey, Anzu, recently in Luminous,
I hear the moniker is all the rage.

source:
杏も得意なモノマネがあったら、
やってみせてくれよ
translatedstr:
If only there was a moniker that Anzu were good at too,
Let me see you do it.

source:
いいけど……あ、じゃあクイズってことにしようか。
間違えたら飴ちょうだいね。それじゃ、いくよ……
translatedstr:
Okay, but ...... Oh, let's call it a quiz then.
If I make a mistake, please give me candy...I'm off then: ......

source: 『ゲームしながら、お菓子……にへへ、幸せ……』
translatedstr: 'While playing the game, hehehe, happy ...... to sweets ......'

source: 分かったぞ！　杏がモノマネしたのは……
translatedstr: All right, I got it! Anzu did the moniker: ......

source: 甜花
translatedstr: Tenka

source: 美希
translatedstr: Miki

source: 静香
translatedstr: Shizuka

source: 甜花だな？
translatedstr: Tenka, right?

source:
ぐぬぬ、正解だよ。
杏のモノマネがうますぎたみたいだね
translatedstr:
Gunno, you're right.
Looks like Anzu's impersonation was too good.

source: （よし、無事に当てられたぞ！）
translatedstr: (Okay, you guessed right!)

source: 美希じゃないか？
translatedstr: Isn't that Miki?

source:
ううん、ちがうよ。
ふふっ、約束どおり飴をもらおうか！
translatedstr:
No, no.
Hmmm...let's get some candy as promised!

source: （うっ……間違えてしまったか）
translatedstr: (Ugh, I must have made a mistake at ......)

source: もしかして、静香か？
translatedstr: Perhaps it's Shizuka?

source:
ざんねん、間違いだよ。
はい、飴ちょうだい
translatedstr:
Sorry, you're wrong.
Yes, give me some candy.

source: （違ったようだ……）
translatedstr: (I guess not. ......)

source:
（杏の仕事終わり、
気分転換を兼ねて出かけることにした……）
translatedstr:
(End of Anzu work,
I decided to go out for a change (......)

source:
（もうこんな時間か……。
杏も楽しんでくれたようだな）
translatedstr:
(Is it that time already? .......
(I see you enjoyed the Anzu, too.)

source:
働かなくていいって素敵だよね。
毎日がこの調子だったらいいのに……
translatedstr:
It's nice not to have to work.
I wish every day was like this. ......

source:
プロデューサーのおかげでゆっくりできたし、たまに
はお礼を言おうかな……だから明日も休んでいい？
translatedstr:
I've been able to slow down thanks to my producer, and sometimes
can I thank you for the ...... so I can get some rest tomorrow?

source: 杏じゃないか、おはよう！
translatedstr: Good morning, isn't it Anzu?

source:
あ。おはよ～、プロデューサー。
今日も朝から元気だね……ふぁぁ
translatedstr:
Good morning, producer.
You're looking good this morning. ...... Huh.

source:
杏はちょっとお疲れ気味だな。
最近のルミナスの調子はどんな感じだ？
translatedstr:
Anzu is a little tired.
How's Luminous doing these days?

source:
うん。個性的な子が多くていいと思うよ。
それに、元気いっぱいな子がいると心強いよね
translatedstr:
Yes, I think it's great that there are so many unique kids.
Besides, it's reassuring to have a child who's full of energy.

source:
心強い……？　アイドルとして、
信頼できる仲間って意味か？
translatedstr:
Reassuring ......? as an idol,
You mean trusted associates?

source:
うん。そういうことだよね。みんな元気だから、
少しくらい杏が休んだって平気かなって！
translatedstr:
Yeah, that's how it is, everyone is fine,
I thought it would be fine if Anzu took a little bit of time off!

source:
……杏も元気いっぱいな子に混ざって、
積極的に活動をするんだぞ
translatedstr:
...... Anzu is also mixed in with the energetic kids,
You're going to have to be proactive.

source: あっ、プロデューサー……
translatedstr: Oh, the producer ......

source:
おはよう、杏。
ん？　そっちは事務所と逆方向だぞ
translatedstr:
Good morning, Anzu.
You're going in the opposite direction from the office.

source:
えーっと……杏は急用を思い出したから、
今日はこれで失礼させてもらおうかなって！
translatedstr:
Let's see, ...... Anzu because I remembered something urgent,
I thought I should be excused for today!

source:
急用なら仕方ないな。コンビニでみんなで食べる
飴を買ったんだが、杏が食べる前になくなりそうだな
translatedstr:
If it's urgent, I don't blame you, we'll all eat at the convenience store.
I bought some candy, but it's going to be gone before Anzu eat it.

source:
ね、ねぇ。
その飴、杏も食べたいんだけど
translatedstr:
Hey, hey.
I'd like to try that candy, Anzu too.

source: それじゃ、一緒に事務所に行こうか
translatedstr: Well, then, let's go to the office together.

source:
なんか、プロデューサーに
上手くのせられた気がするけど……。ま、いっか
translatedstr:
Something about the producer.
I think I got it right, but ............oh well....

source:
あれ、プロデューサーじゃん。
まだ帰ってなかったの？
translatedstr:
Hey, that's the producer.
You weren't home yet?

source:
お疲れ様、杏。
今帰りか？
translatedstr: You're home now?

source:
うん、今から帰るところだったけど……。
プロデューサーもよく働くね
translatedstr:
Yeah, I was just about to leave now. ......
Producers work hard too.

source:
ま、プロデューサーが頑張ってくれてるから、
杏も安心してサボ……活動できてるよ
translatedstr:
Well, the producer is doing a great job,
Anzu is also a safe and secure sabo ...... activity.

source:
そうか。
杏の役に立ててるのなら、よかったよ
translatedstr:
Okay.
I'm glad you're helping Anzu.

source:
これからもその調子で、
どんどん杏を楽させてね、プロデューサー♪
translatedstr:
Keep up the good work,
Keep making it easier for me, producer♪

source:
……楽をさせるつもりは無いけれど、
杏が望む活動ができるように、努力するよ
translatedstr:
I don't mean to make ...... easy, though,
I'll do my best to make sure you get the activity you want Anzu.

source:
おはよう、プロデューサー。
今日もテキトーによろしくー
translatedstr:
Good morning, producer.
Good luck to all Texans today!

source:
おはよう、プロデューサー。
お互い、これから労働なんてつらいよねー
translatedstr:
Good morning, producer.
It's so hard for both of us to be working from now on!

source:
ふぅ……。ようやく労働から解放された……。
あ、プロデューサー。お疲れ様ー
translatedstr:
Phew. ....... Finally free from labor. .......
Oh, producer, thank you for your hard work!

source:
杏、すっごく頑張ったよね？
だから１０連休くらいほしいなぁ……。チラチラ？
translatedstr:
Anzu, you worked really hard, didn't you?
So I'd like at least 10 holidays in a row. .........glimpses?
